intro: Lathyrus luteus f. parvifolius, commonly known as the dwarf yellow vetch, is a compact, herbaceous perennial native to southern Europe. It features small, trifoliate leaves and produces delicate, yellowish-pink flowers in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, making it well-suited for rock gardens or as a border plant. Its foliage is characterized by its finely divided leaves, which contribute to its ornamental appeal. The species is noted for its adaptability to well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade conditions.
